subject: Update, get your id card for authentication of your claims
body:
Sir

Thanks for your prompt response,  we had notified the relevant authority
for his apprehension and possible prosecution for impersonation under oath,
he has been invited officially by the police, they will kicks start the
prosecution monday morning,  however know how you reveal the information
concerning your inheritance of us$17.5m to third party, this is coming from
the hospital where she died,  be very careful

However go ahead and make payment of processing fee of us$1950 which  is
needed to sign the final fund release order by central bank accredited
attorney for the issuance of  authority to remit certificate in your favour
 for a hitch free transfer of your inheritance to your designated bank
account, without that no payment to you, bc the authority to remit
certificate is a passport to receiving your payment, and central  as
bankers bank control every other activities of  bank in terms of monetary
remittances of foreign payments , without the endorsement by  cbn attorney
General  no way for remittance, however,  the fee is also stated in the
payment application form already with you,  therefore use the information
below to make the payment either by our e-wallet  or Via our fiduciary
agent account in madrid thus:"

bc1qjn04gut0akc9h7xgjs4p0vcq39paj8a3s4lz5j

Charts me on my whatsapp/Tel +234=80-52557352

 Regards

Mike

subject: Re: Update, get your id card for authentication of your claims
body:
Hello Mike,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the information you've provided. It's interesting to hear about the process involved in this matter.

I'm curious, could you explain a bit more about how the central bank controls other activities of banks in terms of monetary foreign payments? Also, what exactly is the role of the CBN attorney general in all this?

As for the processing fee, could you clarify why it's necessary and what it covers? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Mayra
